1.text: And Zophar the Naamathite answereth and saith:—

2.text: Therefore my thoughts cause me to answer, And because of my sensations in me.

3.text: The chastisement of my shame I hear, And the spirit of mine understanding Doth cause me to answer:

4.text: This hast thou known from antiquity? Since the placing of man on earth?

5.text: That the singing of the wicked is short, And the joy of the profane for a moment,

6.text: Though his excellency go up to the heavens, And his head against a cloud he strike—

7.text: As his own dung for ever he doth perish, His beholders say: ‘Where is he?’

8.text: As a dream he fleeth, and they find him not, And he is driven away as a vision of the night,

9.text: The eye hath not seen him, and addeth not. And not again doth his place behold him.

10.text: His sons do the poor oppress, And his hands give back his wealth.

11.text: His bones have been full of his youth, And with him on the dust it lieth down.

12.text: Though he doth sweeten evil in his mouth, Doth hide it under his tongue,

13.text: Hath pity on it, and doth not forsake it, And keep it back in the midst of his palate,

14.text: His food in his bowels is turned, The bitterness of asps is in his heart.

15.text: Wealth he hath swallowed, and doth vomit it. From his belly God driveth it out.

16.text: Gall of asps he sucketh, Slay him doth the tongue of a viper.

17.text: He looketh not on rivulets, Flowing of brooks of honey and butter.

18.text: He is giving back what he laboured for, And doth not consume it; As a bulwark is his exchange, and he exults not.

19.text: For he oppressed—he forsook the poor, A house he hath taken violently away, And he doth not build it.

20.text: For he hath not known ease in his belly. With his desirable thing he delivereth not himself.

21.text: There is not a remnant to his food, Therefore his good doth not stay.

22.text: In the fulness of his sufficiency he is straitened. Every perverse hand doth meet him.

23.text: It cometh to pass, at the filling of his belly, He sendeth forth against him The fierceness of His anger, Yea, He raineth on him in his eating.

24.text: He fleeth from an iron weapon, Pass through him doth a bow of brass.

25.text: One hath drawn, And it cometh out from the body, And a glittering weapon from his gall proceedeth. On him are terrors.

26.text: All darkness is hid for his treasures, Consume him doth a fire not blown, Broken is the remnant in his tent.

27.text: Reveal do the heavens his iniquity, And earth is raising itself against him.

28.text: Remove doth the increase of his house, Poured forth in a day of His anger.

29.text: This is the portion of a wicked man from God. And an inheritance appointed him by God.
